abstracts.cdata!:
The Dam Safety Project for Armenia had a
            highly satisfactory outcome and moderate risk to development
            outcome. Both the Bank and the borrower performances were
            highly satisfactory. The main lessons learned were: (1)
            Assessment of dam safety is complicated. For countries such
            as Armenia, to identify a problem in a dam, assess its
            potential impact, and propose measures to improve dam safety
            are difficult. It needs a deep level of experience which
            most often can be provided largely by international experts.
            (2) Training is essential for the staff of the project
            implementation unit and Water Supply Agency (WSA) on dam
            safety aspects especially as this is a very specialized
            field. (3) Establishing a separate dam agency for operation
            and maintenance or a separate unit within the WSA is
            recommendable because dam operation and maintenance is a
            very specialized task which requires significant experience
            and high professional skills. (4) Improving dam safety
            promotes private investment downstream the rehabilitated
            dams as result of potentially more reliable water supply and
            more effective safety structures. (5) Improvement of dam
            management and optimization of water utilization is still
            needed in the country. This would involve computer based
            operation and maintenance and may be construction of new
            dams especially on the rivers which have the potential for
            cascade dams.
